title: Zayed Al Khair convoys provide health care to underprivileged people of Sindh
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jun 13 (APP): Zayed Al Khair convoys (of United Arab Emirates) in collaboration with Pakistanâ€™s Ministry of Health provided free health care services including diagnostic, curative and preventive medical facilities to poor hailing from far flung areas of Sindh province on Sunday.
Spokesperson UAE Embassy told APP that the medical relief was being provided as a part of the Zayed Humanitarian Campaign to treat underprivileged people of the country.
Humanitarian services was being supervised by the specialist medical team of a doctors hailing from both the UAE and Pakistan.
They also distributed medicines, including cough syrup and other health care tablets among the people free of charge.
Reported By Shabbir Hussain
APP, Digital News Service
